comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content:
Oh, Father dear, I oft times hear you speak of Erin's Isle, 
Her lofty scene, her valleys green, her mountains rude and wild 
They say it is a pretty place where in a prince might dwell, 
Oh, why did you abandon it, the reason to me tell?

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content:
And you were only two years old and feeble was your frame, 
I could not leave you with your friends, you bore your father's name, 
I wrapped you in my cóta mór in the dead of night unseen 
I heaved a sigh and said goodbye to dear old Skibbereen

comment.author: 29809546@N00
comment._content:
Definitely too early for the sports in question, but Freeman's had a report of Skibbereen Sports which was held on July 6th 1898
SKIBBEREEN SPORTS The Skibbereen annual sports came off yesterday at Curragh in a splendid field on the outskirts of town in charming weather and in the presence of an enormous attendance of spectators far and near. There were Chamionships of Munster given, namely, Three Mile Flat race and High Jump, the latter being won by Wood, of Enniskeane, and the former by W O'Connel, of Cork. The arrangements in every respect were perfection and the different events well contested and most exciting. The juvenile brass band of the Baltimore Fishing Industrial School played a choice program me of music during the day

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: John Maguire (retired stonecutter) and Joseph Maguire (stonecutter) are at Douglas Street in the 1901 census Mulgrave Road could have been the location of their workshop. At the time Mulgrave Road included what is now John Redmond Street where there is a cemetery (behind the Maldron Hotel) Can't find either in 1911 census

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: The only Sheehy listed in the census is in 1911, being a farmer. www.census.nationalarchives.ie/search/results.jsp?census_... No listing in 1901. I was hoping he'd be listed in the Griffith's Valuations, no luck either. www.askaboutireland.ie/griffith-valuation/

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: From the current Google map, Sheehy's appears to be a real estate office now. :)

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Here's a page with Guy's postal directory of 1914 showing: Sheehy Timothy, COC, UDC, Market street. He was born in 1855, so in 1911 he would be 55-56. Yep, there he is in the 1911 census in Market Street. in 1901 he's shown as a Coal and Test Merchant, whatever that is supposed to be. His occupation is recorded as "Coal merchant and assistant in licensed house". His son Michael is assisting with the coal store.

comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] ok that's cool! We can look him up in the Graveyards directory: www.graveyards.skibbheritage.com/
